answers.answer: PCOS and insulin resistance/diabetes often go hand in hand.

question: I recently saw a doctor who refered me to get looked at for PCOS.  He also ran a bloodtest which came back with my blood sugar being high (129 i believe).  I did not fast before this however. I ate a part of a fried sandwich approx. 4 hours before the test.  Next week I have to take another blood test after fasting, then i have to eat and give another sample two hours later.  Could this be related to PCOS, and should I be worried?  Is it likely that the test was just off because I did not fast prior to the test.
title: High Blood Sugar/PCOS
